benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoicePayments/{paymentId}/customFields - Add custom fields to payment

covered: Valid Payload: Multiple happy-path scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05) validate successful creation and returned 201 with JSON array of created CustomField objects.
Required and optional headers: Tests cover the required X-Killbill-CreatedBy header and optional X-Killbill-Reason and X-Killbill-Comment (TC01, TC02, TC09).
Malformed/invalid payloads: Malformed JSON (TC08) and missing required CustomField properties (TC16) are tested.
Input validation for paymentId: Invalid format (TC10) and non-existent paymentId (TC11) are tested, covering 400 and 404 cases from the story.
Authentication/Authorization: Unauthorized or missing auth token scenario (TC12) and missing required header (TC09) are present.
Edge cases and robustness: Empty array (TC07), extra/unexpected fields (TC06), SQL/XSS injection attempts (TC14), and very large payloads (TC15) are included.
Service error handling: Dependent service / DB down scenario is covered (TC13 -> 503).
Concurrency & duplicate/edge behavior: Concurrent requests (TC19) and duplicate field-name regression (TC20) are covered.
Unicode and internationalization: Unicode characters handling is covered (TC21).
Performance & SLA: Normal and peak load performance tests are included (TC22, TC23).
Integration and persistence: Post + subsequent GET persistence check and cross-system consistency tests are included (TC24, TC25).
Documentation/accessibility: API docs accessibility scenario is present (TC26).
gaps: Content-Type validation: No explicit scenario for missing or incorrect Content-Type header (e.g., not application/json) and expected 415/400 behaviour is not covered.
Non-array JSON body: No explicit test for a well-formed JSON that is not an array (e.g., object instead of array) which should be validated as invalid per schema.
Invalid field data types / value validation: Tests cover missing fields but not explicit invalid types for CustomField properties (e.g., non-string fieldName/fieldValue or invalid objectType).
Exact objectType and field constraints: No test asserting the expected objectType value (e.g., that objectType corresponds to invoice payment) or constraints on allowed fieldName patterns/lengths.
Duplicate submission / idempotency: No test that retries identical requests (duplicate submission) to verify idempotency or deduplication handling.
Internal server error (500): Only 503 is simulated; a generic 500 Internal Server Error case and the API’s behavior/response body for unexpected server failures are not covered.
Response headers and content-type: No tests assert response Content-Type or other headers (e.g., Location, ETag, or custom headers) on success or error.

Behavior for adding fields that collide with existing field names across separate requests: TC04 ensures existing fields remain unchanged, but there is no explicit test for the behavior when adding a field with the same name as an existing one in a subsequent request (whether it creates a duplicate or errors).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for how the API handles excessive request rates (429) or throttling under stress.

Ambiguity-handling tests: Several scenarios use "201 or 400/413" etc.; the tests do not assert a single expected behavior for these ambiguous cases. The API spec should be clarified and tests made deterministic.
recommendations: Add a test for missing/incorrect Content-Type (e.g., Content-Type: text/plain) expecting appropriate error (415 or 400) so clients get clear guidance when they send wrong media types.
Add a test sending a valid JSON object (not array) as the request body and assert a 400 with a clear schema validation error.
Add tests for invalid data types inside CustomField objects (non-string fieldName/fieldValue, invalid enum/objectType) to ensure schema validation is enforced.
Add assertions verifying that the returned CustomField.objectType is the expected value (e.g., invoicePayment) and any constraints on fieldName/fieldValue (length, allowed characters).
Introduce duplicate-submission tests (replay same request) to verify idempotency/deduplication behavior and ensure duplicates aren’t unintentionally created.
Simulate a generic 500 Internal Server Error and verify that the API surfaces a consistent error response to clients (and that metrics/alerts would trigger).
Add tests asserting response headers (Content-Type: application/json and any relevant headers) for both success and error responses.

Add a test for adding a custom field with the same name as an existing field in a subsequent request and assert expected behavior (duplicate allowed vs. rejected) — clarify API behaviour in the spec and codify in tests.
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests to validate 429 responses or graceful degradation under extreme load.
Remove ambiguous "201 or 400/413" expectations by updating the API specification with definitive behaviour, then make tests deterministic (explicit expected status codes and response shapes).
